|Title=Know how to correct chronic metabolic acidosis
|Description=Know how to prescribe alkalinisation in the context of chronic kidney disease.
|Rubric=Management
|Contributors=P Rieu; B Moulin; M Flamant
|Order=8}}


*Treatment is necessary to prevent muscle wasting, bone demineralisation and, in children, stunted growth.
*Maintain plasma bicarbonate levels > 22 mmol/L by taking sodium bicarbonate orally (1 to 6 capsules a day, for example in cases of chronic renal failure).

question.title: What is the primary goal of sodium bicarbonate treatment in chronic metabolic acidosis?

option_a.title: To increase urine production
option_a.description: Maintaining adequate hydration is important, but this is not the primary goal

option_b.title: To correct acidosis by increasing plasma bicarbonate levels

option_c.title: To reduce muscle wasting by increasing potassium levels
option_c.description: This is a potential side effect of sodium bicarbonate treatment, but not the primary goal

option_d.title: To treat bone demineralization by increasing calcium levels
option_d.description: This is a related but secondary effect of sodium bicarbonate treatment in chronic kidney disease
